| --- |
| catalytic triad |

The "Chemical" entities in the paragraph are:

1. catalytic triad

Note: The term "catalytic triad" refers to a set of three amino acid residues in an enzyme that work together to form the active site and facilitate catalysis. It is not a specific chemical compound, but rather a conceptual entity that describes a critical component of enzyme function.
